prompt: <description>**Intermediate CAD Part Instructions** **<part\\_1> - Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** The euler angles for the coordinate system are [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. 2. **Draw a 2D sketch.** a. Draw line 1 from the point [0.0, 0.0] to the point [0.75, 0.0]. b. Draw line 2 from the point [0.75, 0.0] to the point [0.75, 0.75]. c. Draw line 3 from the point [0.75, 0.75] to the point [0.0, 0.75]. d. Draw line 4 from the point [0.0, 0.75] to the point [0.0, 0.0]. 3. **Scale the 2D sketch.** Use a scaling parameter of 0.75. 4. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch.** a. Set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.75. b. Set the extrude depth opposite the normal to 0.0. 5. **Extrude the 2D sketch.** This will create the 3D rectangular prism. **<part\\_2> - Sloped Side Rectangular Prism** Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 1 unit in height. The sloped side is at a 45 degree angle. 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** The euler angles for the coordinate system are [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.0, 0.2885]. 2. **Draw a 2D sketch.** a. Draw line 1 from the point [0.0, 0.0] to the point [0.1965, 0.0]. b. Draw line 2 from the point [0.1965, 0.0] to the point [0.1965, 0.1587]. c. Draw line 3 from the point [0.1965, 0.1587] to the point [0.3793, 0.1587]. d. Draw line 4 from the point [0.3793, 0.1587] to the point [0.3793, 0.3175]. e. Draw line 5 from the point [0.3793, 0.3175] to the point [0.5501, 0.3175]. f. Draw line 6 from the point [0.5501, 0.3175] to the point [0.5501, 0.4615]. g. Draw line 7 from the point [0.5501, 0.4615] to the point [0.0, 0.4615]. h. Draw line 8 from the point [0.0, 0.4615] to the point [0.0, 0.0]. 3. **Scale the 2D sketch.** Use a scaling parameter of 0.5501. 4. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch.** a. Set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.0. b. Set the extrude depth opposite the normal to 0.75. 5. **Extrude the 2D sketch.** This will create the 3D rectangular prism with the sloped side. Note: The instructions are provided without any additional assumptions. The height, width, and length of each of the intermediate parts and the final shape are provided as described in the JSON.</description>
